The thoughts in their minds each different, giving rise to various worlds.
Using such skillful means, cultivating the most excellent practices,
Born from the Buddha's Dharma, thus called Samantabhadra.
Sentient beings all falsely give rise to thoughts of good and evil destinies,
Thereby either being born in the heavens or falling into hell.
Bodhisattvas observe the world, arising from deluded thoughts and karma,
Because deluded thoughts are boundless, the world is also immeasurable.
All lands are manifested by the net of thoughts,
By the skillful means of illusory nets, they can enter all in a single thought.
Eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties are also like this.
The different perceptions of the world, they can equally enter all.
In each and every eye's range, immeasurable eyes all enter.
Various natures have distinctions, immeasurable and indescribable.
What is seen is without distinction, and also without confusion.
Each according to their own karma, experiences the fruits and retributions.
Samantabhadra's power is immeasurable, he knows all of them.
The range of all eyes, great wisdom can enter all.
Thus all worlds, he can discern and know them all.
Yet cultivating all practices, he also never regresses.
The Buddha's teachings, sentient beings' teachings, and the teachings of lands,
The three times are taught like this, he thoroughly understands all.
The future in the past, the present in the future,
The three times mutually seeing each other, each and every one is clear and distinct.
Thus, with immeasurable kinds, enlightening the worlds,
